title: DOJ joins probe of Southwest's holiday flight meltdown: Was schedule 'unrealistic'?
description: The Department of Justice has joined an investigation led by the Department of Transportation into Southwest Airlines' flight cancellation meltdown in December

title: Dad home after being shot when basketball rolled into neighbor's yard
description: A North Carolina man was released from the hospital after he and his 6-year-old daughter were shot by a neighbor in North Carolina in an incident involving a basketball.

title: Fulton County DA says charging decisions to come this summer in 2020 election probe
description: The Fulton County DA will decide on charges in her probe of 2020 election interference this summer, in an announcement that she said "may provoke a significant reaction."

title: Appeals court upholds Apple's control of iPhone app store
description: An appeals court has upheld Apple’s exclusive control over the distribution of iPhone apps

title: Actor Danny Masterson drugged, raped women, prosecutor says
description: A Los Angeles prosecutor told jurors that actor Danny Masterson drugged three women before raping them

title: Trump-aligned super PAC bankrolls $6 million ad campaign attacking DeSantis
description: A super PAC supporting former President Trump has already spent more than $6 million on TV ads attacking Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, who has yet to declare his candidacy.

title: 'Jackass' star Bam Margera charged with punching brother
description: Pennsylvania State Police say they are looking for “Jackass” star Bam Margera.

title: Singer R. Kelly moved to North Carolina prison from Chicago
description: Federal prison officials say singer R. Kelly has been moved from a Chicago correctional center to a medium-security facility in North Carolina

title: Vegas-to-California high-speed train gets bipartisan backing
description: A bipartisan congressional group from Nevada and California is asking the Biden administration to fast-track federal funds for a private company to build a high-speed rail line between Las Vegas and the Los Angeles area

title: After US embassy evacuation, some Americans still struggling to escape Sudan
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the U.S. is "working to facilitate" departure routes.

title: Oscar-nominated composer writes march for Charles' big day
description: From the Oscars to the Coronation: Scottish film composer Patrick Doyle has been commissioned to write the music for King Charles’ Coronation March which will debut, in front of the world, at the royal event at Westminster Abbey on Saturday, May 6

title: Fatal beating of psychiatrist in Italy sparks reforms outcry
description: The fatal beating of a hospital psychiatrist, allegedly by a former patient, has sparked calls in Italy to improve mental health care

title: Respiratory therapist pleads guilty in deaths of 2 patients
description: A former respiratory therapist has pleaded guilty in the deaths of two patients at a Missouri hospital two decades ago

title: 1948 Olympic bronze medalist Herb Douglas dies at 101
description: Herb Douglas, who turned a chance encounter with Jesse Owens as a teenager into fuel to win a bronze medal in the long jump at the 1948 Olympics, has died at 101

title: 1 dead in Oklahoma college shooting, suspect in custody
description: Police say one person is dead and a suspect is in custody after a shooting at a two-year college in Oklahoma

title: Death penalty trial to begin in Pittsburgh synagogue mass shooting
description: Jury selection is set to begin Monday for the federal death penalty trial of a man accused of shooting and killing 11 worshippers at the Tree of Life synagogue.

title: Don Lemon says he was fired by CNN
description: CNN anchor Don Lemon tweeted that he's been terminated from the network.

title: Biden to unveil new efforts to protect S. Korea from nukes
description: U.S. is ready to step up efforts to deter a North Korean attack on South Korea.

title: Michigan official gets house arrest for 2020 ballot sabotage
description: She pleaded no contest to tampering with a ballot box in her own election.

title: Tucker Carlson out at Fox News
description: Fox News host Tucker Carlson and the media company have "agreed to part ways," Fox said in a statement Monday.

title: Drones attack Sevastopol, crashed drone found near Moscow
description: Russian-appointed authorities in Crimea say the military has fended off a Ukrainian strike on a main naval base, while an exploding drone was also reportedly found in a forest near Moscow

title: 'Not very safe' for large-scale evacuation of Americans in Sudan, Kirby says
description: Fighting in Sudan between forces loyal to two rival generals has triggered a mass exodus of foreigners, while locals struggle to escape.

title: 'Gender Queer' tops library group's list of challenged books
description: A report says books with LGBTQ+ themes remain the most likely targets of bans.

title: China affirms ex-Soviet nations' sovereignty after uproar
description: The Chinese government says it respects the sovereignty of former Soviet Union republics after Beijing’s ambassador to France caused an uproar in Europe by saying they aren’t sovereign nations

title: Proud Boys leaders' trial jurors to hear closing arguments
description: Jurors have heard 50 days of testimony by dozens of witnesses since January.

title: Missouri officer fatally shoots man who allegedly pulled gun
description: A man was shot to death by a police officer in suburban St. Louis early Monday after allegedly pulling a gun while being arrested

title: Moscow court rejects appeal from cafe bombing suspect
description: A Russian court has rejected an appeal from a suspect in a bombing that killed a well-known Russian military blogger

title: Kim Potter, officer convicted of killing Daunte Wright, released from prison
description: Former Brooklyn Center Police Officer Kim Potter, who was convicted of killing 20-year-old Daunte Wright in a traffic stop, was released from prison Monday.

title: Len Goodman, long-serving 'Dancing with the Stars' judge, dies at 78
description: "Dancing with the Stars" judge Len Goodman died Saturday at age 78 after a battle with bone cancer, his manager told ABC News.

title: Ed Sheeran hit, Marvin Gaye classic soul of copyright trial
description: Jury selection and opening statements are set to begin in a trial that mashes up Ed Sheeran’s “Thinking Out Loud” with Marvin Gaye’s “Let’s Get It On.”

title: Florida gov in Japan ahead of expected US presidential bid
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is in Japan to meet with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and other officials

title: Instacart delivery drivers in Florida shot at after going to the wrong address
description: A Florida man shot the car of two people after they went to the wrong address trying to deliver an Instacart order, police said.
